intro: Gnaphalium supinum var. subacaule, commonly known as the creeping everlasting, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a prostrate or ascending stem that is often covered with fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. Its leaves are linear to oblanceolate, usually covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
